Why might antivirus software flag this software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Antivirus software like Avast and Kaspersky may flag this software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" because it is mining software, which can be installed by a third party to exploit a PC. This is a false positive, and the software is safe to use.
